original_title: Invest in education plans: Securing the future of the nation’s children
original_body_lines: A strong educational foundation is one of the most powerful investments we can make in our children’s future. In 2023, data from the Department of Census and Statistics revealed that over 3.88 million children were enrolled across 9,103 government schools, while over 137,869 attended private institutions. These young learners, aged 6 to 18, represent the promise of our nation’s future, and supporting their educational journey is crucial for building a brighter and a more prosperous tomorrow.

The rising cost of education, whether locally or abroad makes early financial planning crucial. Limited access to state universities and the increasing trend of pursuing higher education overseas highlight the need for structured savings. Education insurance offers a solution that combines savings with financial protection, ensuring children’s education is uninterrupted, even in uncertain times.

Parents can choose from various education insurance plans offered by insurance providers in the country tailored to meet customised needs. These policies include features such as guaranteed education funds, investment returns, waive off of premiums due to death or disability of the parent, and financial support in the event of a parent’s death easing financial burdens while ensuring the child can continue their education.

Most policies provide flexible payment options, making it easier for families to integrate education savings into their budgets. Education plans which are available in the market has unique features and benefits to cater to the need of the customer. Some plans even provide the option of including extra benefits such as hospitalisation or critical illness coverage, providing peace of mind beyond education.

Investing in education insurance goes beyond securing individual futures it also strengthens the nation. Children are the building blocks of tomorrow’s society, and by ensuring they receive uninterrupted education, parents contribute to national growth and stability. In times of financial instability or personal loss, these policies act as a safety net, ensuring no child’s education is compromised.

Parents gain peace of mind knowing their child’s ambitions will not be derailed, with financial support available at every milestone. Early planning instills disciplined saving habits, helping families focus on long-term goals while aligning with their financial capabilities and the child’s aspirations.

Insurance Association of Sri Lanka (IASL) advocate the importance of education insurance. Investing in education is one of the most valuable gifts parents can give. It’s a promise that, regardless of life’s challenges, their child’s future will remain bright and secure.
As you explore education insurance options, each step taken today not only shapes your child’s tomorrow but also helps build a stronger, more resilient nation.
